intro: Antirhea talaudensis, commonly known as the Talaud antirhea, is a flowering plant native to the Talaud Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Antirhea talaudensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
